intro: Flourensia microphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flourensia, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Flourensia microphylla is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
